programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa Goes Gaga: Lisa's plan to use online fake news to boost her popularity backfires. Lady Gaga guest stars.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bonfire of the Manatees: Marge meets a handsome marine biologist (guest star Alec Baldwin). Will he woo her? Can Homer win her back?

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of Britain's best-loved celebs, including Chris Eubank, Mel C, Olly Alexander and Vic Reeves, have been watching Dragons' Den, Extreme Sisters and lots of other great TV.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do the Goggleboxers think of Race Across the World, The Last of Us, MAFS Aus, WrestleMania, Chess Masters: The Endgame, Love on the Spectrum and Secrets of the Penguins?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'Box this time: The Assembly, Genius Game, The Piano, Scam Interceptors, The Americas, Married at First Sight Australia and BBC News (noisy phones).

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Helicopter pilot Paul, who's also a cross-dresser, embarks on his first date in women's clothing. 'Sexy geeks' Hannah and Dan bond over video games and shared insecurities.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Singletons looking for love include make-up artist Melina, for whom family is everything, a pair of microbiologists, and an ice-cream man hoping to go from Mr Whippy to Mr Right.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do the Goggleboxers think of Race Across the World, The Last of Us, MAFS Aus, WrestleMania, Chess Masters: The Endgame, Love on the Spectrum and Secrets of the Penguins?

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Terry Kitties: Jeffords enlists Peralta's help to solve a case from his past. Santiago invites herself to a competitive training exercise with Holt and Diaz.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Maximum Security: Santiago goes undercover at a women's prison and befriends one of the inmates. Holt and the team plan a fake funeral to catch a hitman.

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Bear's Den Pizza: Brad and Steven's pizza joint in Conway, Arkansas, was initially a success, but business dipped when it developed a reputation for passionless food...

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Ste faces an impossible choice as guilt consumes Dillon and Lucas crumbles. Clare's sinister agenda starts to surface, Donny questions Rex's culpability, and Pearl reaches breaking point.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: The One on a Thai Farm: After a hilltop proposal, hopeless romantic Gavin plans nuptials in Somerset for his fiance Sophie, with a combined theme of farmyard and Thai.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: La Frite: In Los Angeles, Gordon Ramsay visits La Frite, a French restaurant that's being run into the ground by its squabbling family owners.

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Southern Kitchen: Gordon revamps a southern food joint in Virginia, owned by Shane and her daughters. They've poured all their money into it and could face bankruptcy.

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Bear's Den Pizza: Brad and Steven's pizza joint in Conway, Arkansas, was initially a success, but business dipped when it developed a reputation for passionless food...

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: South Boulevard: Gordon visits a Korean-inspired restaurant in Little Rock, Arkansas. Owner Jermaine is $200,000 in debt and needs help turning things around.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Middle Earth Paradigm: Penny's Halloween party puts Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj through a demanding new test of their social skills.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Dumpling Paradox: When Howard seduces Penny's friend and spends the night with her in Penny's flat, Penny asks if she can sleep on Leonard and Sheldon's sofa.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Grasshopper Experiment: Raj panics when his parents arrange a blind date for him. But he discovers that he can talk to her - after a few drinks.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper-Hofstadter Polarization: Sheldon and Leonard fall out when they're asked to collaborate at a physics conference. Penny tries to help but just makes things worse.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Loobenfeld Decay: Leonard and Sheldon each tell a lie to avoid going to see Penny singing on stage in a production of Rent, but Sheldon's fib gets out of control.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pancake Batter Anomaly: Penny volunteers to nurse Sheldon when he's sick. But his friends, who know how miserable he is when he's ill, stay well away.

programme.title: Transformers: Age of Extinction
programme.desc: (2014) Mark Wahlberg stars in part four of the sci-fi action saga. The US has banned co-operation with Autobot and Decepticon aliens. But some have their own agenda.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Marge in Charge
programme.desc: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge: Otto's rock 'n' roll marriage to his girlfriend Becky (Parker Posey) is over as soon as it's begun. So Becky moves in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Marge in Charge
programme.desc: Strong Arms of the Ma: When Marge is mugged, she reacts by working out with weights, but goes too far and ends up as a steroid-crazed bully.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Marge in Charge
programme.desc: The Twisted World of Marge Simpson: Marge opens a pretzel franchise after meeting the Pretzel Man (guest star Jack Lemmon). But Fat Tony wants a slice of the action.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Marge in Charge
programme.desc: In Marge We Trust: Homer discovers that a Japanese dishwashing powder company is using his face as its logo. And Marge dishes out advice to the church's parishioners.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Marge in Charge
programme.desc: Super Franchise Me: Marge opens a catering franchise after her sandwiches become a hit at the school. But then another franchise opens right across the street.

programme.title: New: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - The CuRicksous Case of Bethjamin Button: The new series continues. Beth and Space Beth get nostalgic.

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - Cryo Mort a Rickver: A cryoshop is ripe for the picking in this episode.

programme.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me
programme.desc: (2018) Action comedy starring Mila Kunis and Kate McKinnon. Two friends become embroiled in espionage after one of them gets dumped by a man she didn't even know was a spy. Surprise!

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: (2018) Action crime thriller sequel. Denzel Washington returns as Robert McCall who's looking for revenge after ruthless killers murder an agency contact who he also considered a friend.

programme.title: The Integrity of Joseph Chambers
programme.desc: (2022) Robert Machoian's drama ponders the state of modern masculinity as a cack-handed insurance salesman played by Clayne Crawford heads solo to the woods for a fateful hunting trip.

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: (2008) Action thriller. Liam Neeson stars as a former CIA operative who vows to track down his daughter after she's kidnapped in Paris.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich.

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: (1944) Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly star in Charles Vidor's Technicolor comedy musical about a chorus girl's rise to fame. Featuring songs and a score from Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Sci-fi thriller with Will Smith. In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot. Can he keep an open mind?

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: Attack the Block
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi horror-comedy with John Boyega. Aggressive aliens unwisely pick a tough London housing estate as the beachhead for their invasion. But the locals are no pushovers...

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Oscar-winning actor Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1994) Kicking family action sequel. Hilary Swank takes on the karate kid soubriquet, as the venerable Mr Miyagi helps her to battle her teenage demons.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary...
programme.desc: ...Gentlemen: (2003) Fantasy with Sean Connery. In an alternative Victorian age, can Allan Quatermain, Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and the Invisible Man avert a war?

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
programme.desc: (2018) Finale to the dystopian sci-fi action saga. As the Flare virus ravages the planet, the WCKD organisation experiments on children to find a cure. Can the Gladers save them?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (2010) Remake of the classic martial arts film, starring Jackie Chan and Jaden Smith. A caretaker shows an American boy how to stand up to bullies at his new school in Beijing.

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Mone star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy sequel with Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller and Jessica Alba. Can Greg Focker live up to nightmare dad-in-law Jack's newfound reluctant sort-of respect?

programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Oscar-winning actor Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1994) Kicking family action sequel. Hilary Swank takes on the karate kid soubriquet, as the venerable Mr Miyagi helps her to battle her teenage demons.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary...
programme.desc: ...Gentlemen: (2003) Fantasy with Sean Connery. In an alternative Victorian age, can Allan Quatermain, Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and the Invisible Man avert a war?

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure
programme.desc: (2018) Finale to the dystopian sci-fi action saga. As the Flare virus ravages the planet, the WCKD organisation experiments on children to find a cure. Can the Gladers save them?

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (2010) Remake of the classic martial arts film, starring Jackie Chan and Jaden Smith. A caretaker shows an American boy how to stand up to bullies at his new school in Beijing.

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Mone star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.desc: A comprehensive round-up of the main news stories of the day from the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Escaping Putin
programme.desc: Trapped in Putin's war, Russian soldiers face a deadly choice - obey, die or flee. This is a raw account of their fight for freedom.

programme.title: News at 10 with Gillian Joseph
programme.desc: A comprehensive round-up of the main news stories of the day from the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A lively look at some of the stories that are featuring in tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: The main news of the day with reports and analysis from Sky News correspondents in the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A review of tomorrow's newspapers with a panel of guests and passionate debate about the stories they cover.

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by TV and radio presenter Lisa Snowdon, who ejnoys a hearty breakfast naan filled with bacon and a masala egg, Jimmy makes the most of old jeans to create an unusual feeder for the coatis at the wildlife park, and plant expert Stephan demonstrates the Japanese art of kokedama

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Geraldine and Paul from Leeds, husband and wife Patrick and Bukky from Sheffield, and spouses Stu and Kate from Wigan use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Denmark v Sweden (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Stade de Genve in Switzerland. The Scandinavian rivals were also in the same UEFA Nations League group, with Sweden winning 2-1 in Odense in February and then claiming an emphatic 6-1 victory just a month ago in Solna. They will be looking to build on that fine form as they aim to emulate their triumph in the inaugural tournament in 1984, having reached at least the quarter-finals in every staging they have qualified for since without adding another trophy to their cabinet. The Danes will look to bounce back from their recent setbacks and enjoy a tournament at least as productive as their 2017 showing in the Netherlands, when they were runners-up to the hosts

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Germany v Poland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. Germany will be looking to go one better than in 2022, when they were runners-up to hosts in England, and they go into this tournament in excellent form, having comfortably topped their UEFA Nations League group. Their opponents are playing in their first major championship, but they too go into this competition on the back of some good results in 2025, albeit without facing anyone of the calibre of the Germans. Denmark and Sweden are the other two teams in this group and got their campaigns under way earlier in Geneva, with the top two progressing to the quarter-finals, and the other two teams being eliminated

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Jonathan Ross Special Guests: Oasis
programme.desc: Ahead of their band's much-anticipated reunion, Jonathan takes a look back at the best bits from his interviews with Liam and Noel Gallagher, with the brothers' takes on their bust-up, the Oasis years, family life and, most importantly, each other

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Shazia Mirza, Lucy Porter, Curtis Walker and Tyler West join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to answer questions about black history. Jimmy Akingbola hosts

programme.title: Mel Giedroyc and Martin Clunes Explore Britain by the Book
programme.desc: The acting friends head to Dorset to explore the spectacular scenery and locations made famous by some of Britain's favourite books and films. They walk in the footsteps of Meryl Streep's French Lieutenant's Woman, stoke up the engine on a steam train ride through Enid Blyton country and take a boat trip to the world-famous Durdle Door on the breathtaking Jurassic coast, which proves challenging for the sea-sick Mel despite Martin's best efforts at distracting her by reading bursts of Thomas Hardy

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aleshe, while Lucy Pateman teaches the host and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping, and hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a charity ambassador

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a dish of roasted pineapple, ice cream and doughnuts while chatting to a man inspired to set up his own doughnut company when his children were diagnosed with food allergies. Chef Asma Khan provides authentic Indian cookery, and Lorraine Kelly and Marti Pellow are treated to an Arbroath smoked haddock omelette

programme.title: Addams Family Values
programme.desc: Comedy horror starring Anjelica Huston and Raul Julia. The arrival of baby Pubert leads to some "deadly" games in the Addams household as the jealous Wednesday and Pugsley try to dispose of their new sibling. Morticia and Gomez hire Debbie as a nanny for the new arrival, and Debbie soon attracts the amorous attentions of Uncle Fester. But the nanny's motives prove to be even more sinister than the Addams clan itself.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by TV presenter and property expert Amanda Lamb, sampling a dish of strapastada, which is a Greek form of scrambled eggs. Jimmy collects eggs at the wildlife park, plant expert Chantal Dawson gives a masterclass in propagating house plants, and Max McMurdo is in the workshop making the perfect bedside bookstand

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined down at his Hampshire home this time by singer Lulu, First Dates star Fred Sirieix, and chefs Cyrus Todiwala and Sally Abe.

programme.title: Tour de France Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the first stage of the race, a 184.9km route around Lille. This is the 112th edition of the world's most famous cycling event which started in 1903. Four cyclists have won this race five times, while Great Britain's Chris Froome is the most successful rider of the 21st century, having claimed victory four times thanks to triumphs in 2013, 2015, 2016 and 2017. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the Coral-Eclipse Stakes from Sandown Park. Plus, racing from Haydock Park, including the Old Newton Cup. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Oli Bell and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Bobby Seagull, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Penny Lancaster answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v England (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' opening Group D match, which comes from Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich, Switzerland. England are the holders of this competition, having beaten Germany in the final when hosts three years ago and have since finished as runners-up to Spain in the 2023 FIFA World Cup. They will expect to be contenders once again, but cannot take anything for granted against the French, who have reached at least the quarter-finals of every World Cup and European Championship since 2009 and will feel a major international honour is long overdue. The sides last met in this competition in the last eight of the 2017 tournament when a goal by Jodie Taylor gave the Lionesses a 1-0 win, and another closely fought encounter is expected

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: .The suspects return home and attempt to patch their lives back together, while a surprising connection is revealed. Katherine Newman finds her chances of becoming the US ambassador under threat, and a scapegoat is urgently required to defuse the growing scandal. Psychological thriller, starring Kunal Nayyar, Georgina Campbell, Elyes Gabel, Elizabeth Henstridge and Angel Coulby

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and his mum Penny, Tony Bellew and his son Corey, and Vicky Pattison and her mum Carroll compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romesh's mum Shanthi's method for getting away with murder

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the first stage of the race, a 184.9km route around Lille. This is the 112th edition of the world's most famous cycling event which originally started in 1903. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart. Pampered pooch Max is forced into drastic action when his owner brings home a rescue mongrel to share their Manhattan apartment.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Eddie Kadi to try disco yoga, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a community fundraiser, and Heidi Phillip-Smith demonstrates more latte art

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined for a chat by Danny Jones of McFly and actress Maureen Lipman, while horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith and carpenter Wayne Perrey join forces to help bring bees back to gardens. Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner return with the cookery show, kicking things off with a back-to-basics masterclass for four favourite dishes. They start with tagliata steak with a butterbean mash, before moving on to crispy fried Thai-style bream with a butter lettuce salad. Then it's an aubergine parmigiana schnitzel that is hearty and comforting, and Lisa's summer strawberry sponge with fresh strawberries and piped cream that is the perfect summer showstopper

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan answers a viewer's gardening question, Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a spectacular coastal garden, Claire Lowrie shares advice on summer-proofing houseplants, and Katy Watson reveals how to plant smartly for both droughts and downpours

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the garden makeover team head to Chippenham, Wiltshire to create a traditional formal garden for an inspirational couple. Richard Warren has been a serving Special Constable for 52 years, and dedicates his spare time to running marathons to raise money for charity, and caring for his wife Lynette, who has multiple sclerosis. The team shares tips on how to create a formal pond from scratch, screening solutions for unsightly spots in the garden, and reveals how to mark out a perfectly oval lawn

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: Oscar-winning spy adventure starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger and Adolfo Celi. A Nato aircraft has been stolen by criminal organisation Spectre and the world is threatened by its nuclear payload. Agent 007 is assigned to the case and the trail leads to the Bahamas and the sinister Emilio Largo.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to Islay and gets a lesson in peat cutting, learns about creating a sustainable future, finds out about creating habitat for the corncrake and receives a much-needed golf lesson

programme.title: Scotland Revealed Moments
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge presents views of Stirling's landscape and landmarks from the air, and looks at the role the city played in the history of Scotland

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Reporters travel around the country to find amazing stories from Scotland's past

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Switzerland v Iceland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents coverage of both teams' second Group A match, which comes from Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. The sides were also in the same group in this year's Nations League and the teams could not be separated in their two meetings, drawing 0-0 in Zurich before playing out a 3-3 thriller in Reykjavik, with Iceland forward Karlna Lea Vilhjlmsdttir scoring a hat-trick to help her nation fight back from 3-1 down. Both teams lost their opening contest, with the hosts taking the lead against Norway, but losing 2-1, and Iceland having Hildur Antonsdottir sent off in a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Finland

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Remake of the classic western starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt and Ethan Hawke. When a ruthless land baron sets about persecuting the residents of a small town, a young widow turns to bounty hunter Sam Chisolm for aid. But he's going to need a little help if he is to restore order.

Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner return with the cookery show, kicking things off with a back-to-basics masterclass for four favourite dishes. programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the garden makeover team head to Chippenham, Wiltshire to create a traditional formal garden for an inspirational couple. Richard Warren has been a serving Special Constable for 52 years, and dedicates his spare time to running marathons to raise money for charity, and caring for his wife Lynette, who has multiple sclerosis. programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Switzerland v Iceland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents coverage of both teams' second Group A match, which comes from Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. The sides were also in the same group in this year's Nations League and the teams could not be separated in their two meetings, drawing 0-0 in Zurich before playing out a 3-3 thriller in Reykjavik, with Iceland forward Karlna Lea Vilhjlmsdttir scoring a hat-trick to help her nation fight back from 3-1 down. Both teams lost their opening contest, with the hosts taking the lead against Norway, but losing 2-1, and Iceland having Hildur Antonsdottir sent off in a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Finland

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Remake of the classic western starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt and Ethan Hawke. When a ruthless land baron sets about persecuting the residents of a small town, a young widow turns to bounty hunter Sam Chisolm for aid. But he's going to need a little help if he is to restore order.

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast

programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Geraldine and Paul from Leeds, husband and wife Patrick and Bukky from Sheffield, and spouses Stu and Kate from Wigan use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Denmark v Sweden (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Stade de Genve in Switzerland. The Scandinavian rivals were also in the same UEFA Nations League group, with Sweden winning 2-1 in Odense in February and then claiming an emphatic 6-1 victory just a month ago in Solna. They will be looking to build on that fine form as they aim to emulate their triumph in the inaugural tournament in 1984, having reached at least the quarter-finals in every staging they have qualified for since without adding another trophy to their cabinet. The Danes will look to bounce back from their recent setbacks and enjoy a tournament at least as productive as their 2017 showing in the Netherlands, when they were runners-up to the hosts

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Germany v Poland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. Germany will be looking to go one better than in 2022, when they were runners-up to hosts in England, and they go into this tournament in excellent form, having comfortably topped their UEFA Nations League group. Their opponents are playing in their first major championship, but they too go into this competition on the back of some good results in 2025, albeit without facing anyone of the calibre of the Germans. Denmark and Sweden are the other two teams in this group and got their campaigns under way earlier in Geneva, with the top two progressing to the quarter-finals, and the other two teams being eliminated

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Jonathan Ross Special Guests: Oasis
programme.desc: Ahead of their band's much-anticipated reunion, Jonathan takes a look back at the best bits from his interviews with Liam and Noel Gallagher, with the brothers' takes on their bust-up, the Oasis years, family life and, most importantly, each other

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Shazia Mirza, Lucy Porter, Curtis Walker and Tyler West join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to answer questions about black history. Jimmy Akingbola hosts

programme.title: Mel Giedroyc and Martin Clunes Explore Britain by the Book
programme.desc: The acting friends head to Dorset to explore the spectacular scenery and locations made famous by some of Britain's favourite books and films. They walk in the footsteps of Meryl Streep's French Lieutenant's Woman, stoke up the engine on a steam train ride through Enid Blyton country and take a boat trip to the world-famous Durdle Door on the breathtaking Jurassic coast, which proves challenging for the sea-sick Mel despite Martin's best efforts at distracting her by reading bursts of Thomas Hardy

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aleshe, while Lucy Pateman teaches the host and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping, and hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a charity ambassador

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a dish of roasted pineapple, ice cream and doughnuts while chatting to a man inspired to set up his own doughnut company when his children were diagnosed with food allergies. Chef Asma Khan provides authentic Indian cookery, and Lorraine Kelly and Marti Pellow are treated to an Arbroath smoked haddock omelette

programme.title: Addams Family Values
programme.desc: Comedy horror starring Anjelica Huston and Raul Julia. The arrival of baby Pubert leads to some "deadly" games in the Addams household as the jealous Wednesday and Pugsley try to dispose of their new sibling. Morticia and Gomez hire Debbie as a nanny for the new arrival, and Debbie soon attracts the amorous attentions of Uncle Fester. But the nanny's motives prove to be even more sinister than the Addams clan itself.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by TV presenter and property expert Amanda Lamb, sampling a dish of strapastada, which is a Greek form of scrambled eggs. Jimmy collects eggs at the wildlife park, plant expert Chantal Dawson gives a masterclass in propagating house plants, and Max McMurdo is in the workshop making the perfect bedside bookstand

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined down at his Hampshire home this time by singer Lulu, First Dates star Fred Sirieix, and chefs Cyrus Todiwala and Sally Abe.

programme.title: Tour de France Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the first stage of the race, a 184.9km route around Lille. This is the 112th edition of the world's most famous cycling event which started in 1903. Four cyclists have won this race five times, while Great Britain's Chris Froome is the most successful rider of the 21st century, having claimed victory four times thanks to triumphs in 2013, 2015, 2016 and 2017. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the Coral-Eclipse Stakes from Sandown Park. Plus, racing from Haydock Park, including the Old Newton Cup. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Oli Bell and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Bobby Seagull, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Penny Lancaster answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v England (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' opening Group D match, which comes from Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich, Switzerland. England are the holders of this competition, having beaten Germany in the final when hosts three years ago and have since finished as runners-up to Spain in the 2023 FIFA World Cup. They will expect to be contenders once again, but cannot take anything for granted against the French, who have reached at least the quarter-finals of every World Cup and European Championship since 2009 and will feel a major international honour is long overdue. The sides last met in this competition in the last eight of the 2017 tournament when a goal by Jodie Taylor gave the Lionesses a 1-0 win, and another closely fought encounter is expected

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: .The suspects return home and attempt to patch their lives back together, while a surprising connection is revealed. Katherine Newman finds her chances of becoming the US ambassador under threat, and a scapegoat is urgently required to defuse the growing scandal. Psychological thriller, starring Kunal Nayyar, Georgina Campbell, Elyes Gabel, Elizabeth Henstridge and Angel Coulby

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and his mum Penny, Tony Bellew and his son Corey, and Vicky Pattison and her mum Carroll compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romesh's mum Shanthi's method for getting away with murder

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the Coral-Eclipse Stakes from Sandown Park. Plus, racing from Haydock Park, including the Old Newton Cup. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Oli Bell and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Bobby Seagull, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Penny Lancaster answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v England (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' opening Group D match, which comes from Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich, Switzerland. England are the holders of this competition, having beaten Germany in the final when hosts three years ago and have since finished as runners-up to Spain in the 2023 FIFA World Cup. They will expect to be contenders once again, but cannot take anything for granted against the French, who have reached at least the quarter-finals of every World Cup and European Championship since 2009 and will feel a major international honour is long overdue. The sides last met in this competition in the last eight of the 2017 tournament when a goal by Jodie Taylor gave the Lionesses a 1-0 win, and another closely fought encounter is expected

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: .The suspects return home and attempt to patch their lives back together, while a surprising connection is revealed. Katherine Newman finds her chances of becoming the US ambassador under threat, and a scapegoat is urgently required to defuse the growing scandal. Psychological thriller, starring Kunal Nayyar, Georgina Campbell, Elyes Gabel, Elizabeth Henstridge and Angel Coulby

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and his mum Penny, Tony Bellew and his son Corey, and Vicky Pattison and her mum Carroll compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romesh's mum Shanthi's method for getting away with murder

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the first stage of the race, a 184.9km route around Lille. This is the 112th edition of the world's most famous cycling event which originally started in 1903. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart. Pampered pooch Max is forced into drastic action when his owner brings home a rescue mongrel to share their Manhattan apartment.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Eddie Kadi to try disco yoga, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a community fundraiser, and Heidi Phillip-Smith demonstrates more latte art

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined for a chat by Danny Jones of McFly and actress Maureen Lipman, while horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith and carpenter Wayne Perrey join forces to help bring bees back to gardens. Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner return with the cookery show, kicking things off with a back-to-basics masterclass for four favourite dishes. They start with tagliata steak with a butterbean mash, before moving on to crispy fried Thai-style bream with a butter lettuce salad. Then it's an aubergine parmigiana schnitzel that is hearty and comforting, and Lisa's summer strawberry sponge with fresh strawberries and piped cream that is the perfect summer showstopper

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan answers a viewer's gardening question, Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a spectacular coastal garden, Claire Lowrie shares advice on summer-proofing houseplants, and Katy Watson reveals how to plant smartly for both droughts and downpours

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the garden makeover team head to Chippenham, Wiltshire to create a traditional formal garden for an inspirational couple. Richard Warren has been a serving Special Constable for 52 years, and dedicates his spare time to running marathons to raise money for charity, and caring for his wife Lynette, who has multiple sclerosis. The team shares tips on how to create a formal pond from scratch, screening solutions for unsightly spots in the garden, and reveals how to mark out a perfectly oval lawn

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: Oscar-winning spy adventure starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger and Adolfo Celi. A Nato aircraft has been stolen by criminal organisation Spectre and the world is threatened by its nuclear payload. Agent 007 is assigned to the case and the trail leads to the Bahamas and the sinister Emilio Largo.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to Islay and gets a lesson in peat cutting, learns about creating a sustainable future, finds out about creating habitat for the corncrake and receives a much-needed golf lesson

programme.title: Scotland Revealed Moments
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge presents views of Stirling's landscape and landmarks from the air, and looks at the role the city played in the history of Scotland

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Reporters travel around the country to find amazing stories from Scotland's past

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Switzerland v Iceland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents coverage of both teams' second Group A match, which comes from Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. The sides were also in the same group in this year's Nations League and the teams could not be separated in their two meetings, drawing 0-0 in Zurich before playing out a 3-3 thriller in Reykjavik, with Iceland forward Karlna Lea Vilhjlmsdttir scoring a hat-trick to help her nation fight back from 3-1 down. Both teams lost their opening contest, with the hosts taking the lead against Norway, but losing 2-1, and Iceland having Hildur Antonsdottir sent off in a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Finland

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Remake of the classic western starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt and Ethan Hawke.
